content: virtues/vices arm warmers this was inspired by the hospital bracelets worn by gabriel aka tilda swinton in the movie constantine materials needed 1 skein of lion brand recycled cotton in pebble beach 1 skein of lion brand cotton ease in taupe 1 2 skeins of lion brand cotton ease in stone 4 0 mm crochet hook g large eyed tapestry needle each rectangle will be crocheted in stone edged in taupe and embroidered with pebble beach as roughly illustrated in the following chart directions make 14 with 4 mm crochet hook and stone yarn chain 29 1 single_crochet in second chain from hook and all the way across 28 single_crochet 2 turn chain 1 single_crochet across 28sts x4 3 tie off 4 join taupe yarn in any border stitch single_crochet all the way around approximately 66 sts tie off you will notice in my rectangle that the taupe is missing from the corners of the rectangle this was to indicate that i don t want to add an extra stitch in the corners that would change the stitch count of the rectangles if you prefer the more squared off look the extra stitch would bring by all means add the extra stitch in the corners just be aware of the change in the stitch count that you are making weave in ends 5 with tapestry needle and pebble beach yarn embroider the 7 virtues and the 7 vices on the rectangles one virtue or vice for each rectangle note i recommend using different fonts in different sizes for each virtue and vice to give it an eclectic look examples lust greed sloth envy wrath pride gluttony chastity charity diligence kindness patience humility liberality you can do each of the virtues and vices in any font you wish and any size you wish obviously the longer words need to be done smaller but you do the shorter words in large boldface font just make sure your word fits the rectangle  also if you have trouble go to dictionary com and use the thesaurus to look up shorter alternatives to the words example another word for diligence could be zeal assembly the 7 vices will be for one wrist and the 7 virtues will be for the other wrist 1 take two of the vices/virtues and line them up wrong sides together single_crochet 28 along the seam between the two rectangles you should now have joined rectangles that look something like this i indicated the seam in red though your yarn will be pebble beach 2 repeat the same process for each virtue/vice until you have one large rectangle of 7 virtues and one large rectangle of 7 vices normally i would say line up the rectangles right sides together so that the single crocheted seam would be hidden on
